First-Time Launch As this is the first time you have used the app, would you like each page to present you with a quick guide on how to use it? These guides will not display in landscape mode. \n \nIf you choose no now, you can always undo this decision later at the bottom of the Settings page using the \'Reset Tutorial\' button.
Diabetes Control This app allows you to input data regarding your blood glucose level readings and your insulin intake without over-complicating the whole process.
Settings Before you start entering your data, you might wish to tweak the settings to tailor the app to your needs.
Exporting In the future, you may wish to print your data or send it to your Health Professional. To do this, you have a choice of multiple different layouts that you can use to export your data to PDF. You can even export to CSV for spreadsheets.
Navigation To move to any one of the three pages you will mainly use, you can click the buttons highlighted below. Alternatively, swiping horizontally in any blank space will move you back or forward through the pages.
Adding New Entry Whenever you want to add an entry, simply fill in the boxes on this page and click the highlighted button.
Auto-populated Data Some of the fields will be auto-populated with the app\'s best guess. However, you can change the fields manually if required.
Viewing Previous Input If you wish to see previous data entered similar to that which you are currently entering, click the highlighted button.> For example, if you want to see how much insulin you gave yourself the last time you ate a particular food (e.g. chips), simply add that food to your food eaten list and click the \'See Previous\' button.
Recorded Data All of your data will be displayed here. You can long click the entry or click the \'More Options\' button (three vertical dots) on the right hand side to open a menu of possible actions.
Recorded Data Actions These actions allow you to view all data associated with an entry, edit the entry, or delete the entry altogether.
Graph Control This graph displays your blood glucose readings. You can use scroll the graph horizontally to view a different range of data, or you can pinch to zoom in and out of the graph. \n \nClicking a point on the graph will take you to its corresponding entry on the \'View All\' page.
Range Statistics In horizontal view, the statistics for the given graph range are hidden. Just click the highlighted area to un-hide them.
Settings Help You can click any of the \'?\' buttons at the top of each section to get an overview of the purpose of each setting.
Event List All of your events will be displayed here. You can long click the event or click the \'More Options\' button (three vertical dots) on the right hand side to open a menu of possible actions.>
Event List Actions These actions allow you to change the order of the events throughout your day, change their name or time, or delete the event altogether.
Default Events If at any time you wish to return to the default events provided by the app, clicking this button will revert all changes you\'ve made to your event list (without modifying your data).
Add New Event If you\'ve deleted an event, but wish to replace it with a new one, simply click this button and a blank event will be inserted for you to modify. However, you may only have eight events at any one time.
